song.title: Remember Me
song.chorus: I remember her hair and her warm summer smile I remember caressing so tender and mild I remember the woman I left for the sea and I pray to the heavens she'll remember me
song.verse: I don't remember the night that I left The night that I went off to sail the sea That night of hard drinking it left me bereft Of a good woman whose love was undying and would never cease

We sailed the seas for American gold The captain was wise and the crew they were bold A share for the crown and the rest for the crew With all of these riches to gain, I'd trade them for one night with you

A fortnight from home from the crow's nest a bell A fierce Spanish galleon who long left her load Then from her broadside a black smokey hell Around me the crew was in terror, we heard word the captain had fell
I float in the sea in her soft salty foam I futilely reckon the direction for home Dreaming one day to reaching the shore I'll swim like a madman to hold, that lass in my arms once more
